column1: Manhattan Beach is a city in southwestern Los Angeles County
column2: California
column4: on the Pacific coast south of El Segundo
column5: and north of Hermosa Beach. As of the 2010 census
column8: and in 2019 the population was estimated to be 35
column9: 183.Manhattan Beach is one of the three Beach Cities
column10: along with Hermosa Beach and Redondo Beach
column11: that make up the South Bay region of Los Angeles County. The community is known for a long beach stretching approximately 2.1 miles (3.4 km) and roughly 450 feet (140 m) wide. The climate is unusually moderate because of Manhattan Beach's proximity to the Pacific Ocean
column12: with an average year-round high temperature of 69.1 °F (20.6 °C) and an average year-round low of 56.4 °F (13.6 °C).

column1: Its schools are run independently of Los Angeles Unified School District with a separate school board based in Manhattan Beach. Mira Costa High School in Manhattan Beach is ranked in the top 1% of high schools nationally and has students from both Manhattan Beach and Hermosa Beach.According to a May 18
column2: 2017 PropertyShark study
column3: the City of Manhattan Beach's 90266 zip code ranked as the 32nd most expensive zip code in the United States. According to a December 2017 PropertyShark study
column4: the City of Manhattan Beach had the highest median price per square foot for residential properties ($943 per square foot) of all 88 cities in L.A. County
column5: ahead of Malibu and Beverly Hills. The residents have a median age of 44.2 years
column7: and 55.6% are married. Manhattan Beach is known for having less traffic congestion than other parts of Los Angeles
column8: along with many fine dining options
column9: and a casual beach culture. According to a March 6
column10: 2020 article in several newspapers (including the Orange County Register)
column11: the City of Manhattan Beach California was ranked as the "Best City" to live in the United States. The study ranking Manhattan Beach as the nation's top city was conducted by 24/7 Wall St.

column1: == History ==
The sandy coastal area was likely inhabited by the Tongva tribe of Native Americans. Archeological work in the nearby Chowigna excavation show evidence of inhabitants as far back as 7
column2: 100 years ago. The Tongva Village of Ongovanga was located near neighbouring Redondo Beach. It has been mentioned at the Historical Society that the location of a portion of current day Manhattan Beach may have been used as a Native American burial grounds.In the mid-18th century
column3: the Portolá expedition was the first European land exploration of present-day California. It traveled north from San Diego to the San Gabriel Valley
column4: Los Angeles Basin
column8: the Spanish Crown deeded Rancho San Pedro
column11: to soldier Juan José Domínguez. It included what is today the entire Port of Los Angeles; San Pedro
column14: Los Angeles; Carson; Compton; the Dominguez Hills; Lomita; the Palos Verdes Peninsula; Redondo Beach; Hermosa Beach; Manhattan Beach; and Torrance.

column2: a Scottish immigrant
column4: purchased Rancho Sausal Redondo and Rancho Aguaje de la Centinela from Avila's heirs for $33
column6: Burnett leased the ranch to a Canadian
column7: Daniel Freeman (not the American of the same name
column8: who was the first to file a claim under the Homestead Act of 1862). Burnett returned to Scotland. Freeman moved his wife and three children onto the ranch and started growing various crops. On May 4
column10: Freeman bought the ranch from Burnett for $140
column11: 000. At some point after this the location was informally called "Shore Acres."

column1: George H. Peck owned the land that became part of the north section of Manhattan Beach. A coin flip decided the town's name. Around 1902
column2: the beach suburb was named "Manhattan" after developer Stewart Merrill's home
column3: the New York City borough of Manhattan.Upon the city's incorporation in 1912
column4: Peck divided out a 2 block area for minority residents on the beachfront. The Bruce family bought some of the area and developed it into the first beach resort for Black Americans in Los Angeles
column6: the Ku Klux Klan began violently harassing the resort’s visitors
column8: and four other Black families that bought lots. In 1924
column9: the city condemned the neighborhood and seized the land from the Black property owners under the pretense of building a park."Beach" was appended to the city's name
column11: at the behest of the postmaster.The land in Manhattan Beach was formerly sand dunes. During the 1920s and 1930s
column12: Kuhn Brothers Construction Company leveled uneven sandy sites and some excess sand was sold and shipped to Waikiki
column14: to convert their reef and rock beach into a sandy beach. The sand was also used to build the Los Angeles Coliseum and portions of the Pacific Coast Highway.The McMartin preschool trials
column15: allegedly an example of day care sex abuse hysteria
column16: started with investigations of a Manhattan Beach preschool in 1983.  The trials ran from 1987 to 1990 and resulted in no convictions.  HBO dramatized this case in the Emmy-winning Indictment: The McMartin Trial
column17: which was partially filmed in Manhattan Beach.The Manhattan Beach Historical Society is now in charge of preserving the history of the city.

column1: == Geography ==
=== Climate ===

Manhattan Beach benefits from ocean breezes that provide clean air and summer temperatures that are 10 to 20 °F (5.6 to 11.1 °C) cooler than the inland regions of Southern California. The Manhattan Beach Unified School District has test scores ranked #3 in the state of California according to California Department of Education statistics. Forbes magazine ranked Manhattan Beach Unified as the sixth best School District in the U.S. According to a July 5
column3: article in the Beach Reporter newspaper
column4: the city of Manhattan Beach has more educated residents (according to percentage of residents with bachelor's degree or higher) than any other Los Angeles suburb.Many high-profile individuals in the sports and entertainment industry live in Manhattan Beach due to its oceanfront desirability
column6: and commuting distance to Los Angeles. GQ Magazine named Manhattan Beach one of the nation's six best beaches in their July 2014 issue.

column1: The city has a total area of 3.9 square miles (10 km2). Manhattan Beach features 2.1 miles (3.4 km) of ocean frontage.
=== Beach and sand dunes ===
Manhattan Beach is a hotspot for beach volleyball and surfing.
A majority of the land in Manhattan Beach was once exposed sand dunes
column2: which now lie beneath the city's buildings and streets. The underlying dunes afford residents ocean views throughout western portions of the city. The tallest hill is 244 feet high
column3: and it is located in the city's southwest region. The only remaining exposed sand dune is at Sand Dune Park
column4: where sand resembling the original landscape can also be found. In the late 1920s
column5: excess sand from Manhattan Beach was purchased by Hawaiʻian developers
column6: who negotiated a deal with the Kuhn Brothers Construction Company to ship the sand across the Pacific Ocean from Manhattan Beach via Los Angeles Harbor to Waikiki Beach over a ten-year period.

column1: The beach is approximately 2.1 miles long and 400 feet wide. In the early part of the last century
column2: the beach was narrow (approximately 150 feet) and sloping. From 1938 to 1989
column3: it more than doubled in width when large quantities of sand were placed on beaches to the north during construction of the Hyperion Treatment Plant
column4: Marina del Rey
column5: and Scattergood Power Plant. The sand was carried southward by the ocean's natural littoral flow and widened Manhattan Beach.Every August
column6: the city hosts the Manhattan Beach Open Volleyball Tournament and the International Surf Festival.

column1: === Neighborhoods ===
The city has several distinct neighborhoods
column2: including the "Strand"  "Sand Section"
column4: "Tree Section"
column16: and "El Porto" (North Manhattan Beach). The Roth Tract
column18: is sometimes referred to as the "Bird Section."

column1: The "Hill Section" is known for its high-priced homes; many of the residences are remodeled or newly constructed. The steep hills allow panoramic ocean and city views.

The "Sand Section" has quiet walk-street neighborhoods adjacent to the ocean. Oceanfront homes stretch along the bike path and walking lane of "The Strand". "The Strand" section of Manhattan Beach includes some of the most expensive real estate per square foot in the United States.Since 2010
column2: new property developments in Manhattan Beach cannot exceed two lot parcels. Size and appearance restrictions were enacted by the Manhattan Beach City Council to preserve the appearance of the beachfront community after three lots were joined to create a 16

column1: ==== Downtown ====

Downtown Manhattan Beach is considered the heart of the city. The area runs along Manhattan Beach Boulevard and the streets perpendicular to the Manhattan Beach Pier and Valley Drive. There are Zagat rated casual-fine dining restaurants
column2: specialty boutiques and retailers that create a pedestrian friendly
column3: mixed-use downtown center.  The Metlox site
column4: where the pottery factory once stood for decades
column5: was closed in the early 1990s and redeveloped into a mixed-use center. The Metlox site includes a luxury boutique hotel

column1: ==== North Manhattan Beach District ====

North Manhattan Beach business district is located near the intersection of Rosecrans and Highland and has restaurants and shops. The district is defined as covering "32nd Street to 45th Street and consist[s] of over 80 businesses".
==== Rosecrans Corridor ====
The Rosecrans corridor is located on the south side of Rosecrans Avenue
column2: east of Sepulveda

column1: The Manhattan Beach Country Club
column2: the westdrift Manhattan Beach Hotel and Golf Course
column4: restaurants
column7: and shopping centers border the Rosecrans corridor between Sepulveda and Aviation Boulevards. The Rosecrans corridor is adjacent to The Point and Plaza El Segundo off Sepulveda Blvd
column8: which features additional retailers including Whole Foods Market.

column1: ==== Sepulveda Corridor ====
The Sepulveda Corridor occupies the commercial zone
column2: and is the city's main north-south highway. The area includes the Manhattan Village Mall
column3: which is located east of Sepulveda Boulevard between Marine and Rosecrans Avenues. The mall
column4: built in the early 1980s
column5: was remodeled in the late 1990s and early 2000s. The mall is anchored by Macy's on both ends and tenants include Pottery Barn
column8: and the Apple Store. Many restaurants such as Islands
column11: and the Tin Roof are co-located with the mall. The Manhattan Village Mall is executing a multimillion-dollar redevelopment which adds both outdoor and enclosed retail and restaurant space. There are several medium-size hotels
column19: small shopping centers and a Target store along this corridor. Kaiser Permanente's medical offices include a laboratory and pharmacy.

column1: ==== Aviation Corridor ====
The Aviation Corridor is located along Aviation Boulevard (the city's eastern boundary)
column2: south of Rosecrans Avenue
column3: and north of Marine Avenue. Aviation High School was located at the intersection of Manhattan Beach Blvd. and Aviation until it closed in the early 1980s. The zone includes several major entertainment and aerospace complexes
column4: including Manhattan Beach Studios and the Northrop Grumman Space Park Complex. Manhattan Beach Media Campus has production for movies and entertainment including the Marvel pictures "Thor" and "Iron Man 2" and both sequels to James Cameron's "Avatar" movie. The studio complex has large photovoltaic solar panel rooftop installations in the area which generates approximately 1 megawatt of power.

column1: == Parks and recreation ==
The wide sandy beaches attracts over 3.8 million visitors annually. Beach volleyball
column2: swimming
column3: body boarding and surfing are popular activities among residents and visitors. Popular surf spots include the Pier and El Porto. Lifeguard stations are located along the entire length of the beach and the beach is cleaned and groomed daily by crews from LA County Beaches and Harbors Department. Along the Strand at the eastern edge of the beach
column4: a concrete bike path is reserved for bicycles. The bikeway extends north to Santa Monica and south to Torrance. A separate 2.1-mile (3.4 km) walkway
column6: runs alongside the bike path. Restrooms and shower facilities are provided adjacent to the Strand paths. An area known as the "Green Belt" or "Veteran's Parkway" is a pedestrian-friendly walkway that runs adjacent to Valley Drive and Ardmore Avenue near downtown Manhattan Beach. Nearly 20 acres (8.1 ha) and 3 miles (4.8 km) long
column7: the wood-chip walkway is a popular trail for runners and dog-walkers.

column1: There are several public parks in the city. The largest and most popular is Polliwog Park located on Manhattan Beach Boulevard
column2: two blocks west of Aviation Boulevard. Polliwog Park includes the Manhattan Beach Botanical Garden
column3: as well as a small lake
column4: open-air concert amphitheater
column8: and a fenced dog exercise area. It is also the site of the Manhattan Beach Historical Society Red Cottage
column9: which is home to the city's collection of historical artifacts. Marine Avenue Park
column10: west of Aviation Boulevard on Marine
column13: and an indoor racket ball facility.  A small skate park was added to Marine Avenue Park in 2017 after a 16-year battle over its location. Live Oak Park in the downtown area has ball fields
column15: tennis courts and picnic tables.  Bruce's Beach (formerly Culiacan Park) is north of downtown.

column1: For over 50 years
column2: the city of Manhattan Beach hosts an annual Hometown Fair at Live Oak Park in downtown Manhattan Beach. Popular among community residents
column3: the fair features food and drink
column4: live music
column5: games and booths to raise funds for local causes.

column1: CNNMoney named Manhattan Beach #1 as the "2011 Best Places For the Rich and Single"
column2: while The Travel Channel named Manhattan Beach the 9th sexiest beach on earth for its 2008 "21 Sexiest Beaches" show.

column1: == Government ==
=== Local government ===

The city of Manhattan Beach is governed by a five-member City Council. City Council members are elected every four years. The office of the Mayor of Manhattan Beach rotates every nine months among the members of the City Council
column2: so that each City Council member serves one term as Mayor.  A City Manager is appointed by the City Council. An elected City Treasurer serves a four-year term.

column1: The Beach Cities Health District
column2: provides health and wellness services to the residents of Hermosa Beach
column4: and Redondo Beach. It is funded partially by over $3 million annually from property taxes. The voters of the three beach cities elect the 5-member Board of Directors to 4-year terms. One of 78 California Health Districts
column5: it was created in 1955 as South Bay Hospital which no longer exists and took on its current name in 1993. Beach Cities Health District is now focused on real estate development and opened AdventurePlex
column6: a Manhattan Beach fitness center for kids and their families
column12: AdventurePlex challenges children physically and intellectually in health-focused recreational activities.

column1: === County government ===

Manhattan Beach is in the Fourth Supervisorial District of Los Angeles County. Janice Hahn is the District Supervisor. The county collects taxes on properties in Manhattan Beach and maintains property assessment rolls. Los Angeles County maintains the beach and provides daily cleaning and grooming. The county also maintains the bike path at the eastern edge of the beach.
The Manhattan Beach County Library is located downtown on Highland Avenue two blocks north of Manhattan Beach Boulevard. The library is part of the County of Los Angeles Public Library system
column2: and includes internet accessible computers
column4: and access to the six million items in the county library collection. The new $19 million
column7: two story facility featuring a glass exterior was completed in 2015.

column1: == Education ==
Public education in Manhattan Beach is provided by the Manhattan Beach Unified School District
column2: which oversees five elementary schools (Grand View
column4: Pacific
column7: one middle school (Manhattan Beach Middle School)
column8: and one high school (Mira Costa High School).

column1: The Manhattan Beach Unified School district is ranked as the third-best-performing school district in the state of California. The district received a score of 926 on the 2010 California Academic Performance Index. Each individual school also ranks at the top of its respective category.
Manhattan Beach is currently ranked as one of the best suburbs in Los Angeles Country for its high-earning and well educated residents. According to US Census data
column2: Manhattan Beach holds the ranking as the second most educated city in Los Angeles County and the fifth most educated city in the state of California. Manhattan Beach's top performing school district is currently ranked as the third best in the state of California
column3: and Forbes Magazine ranked the city's school district
column4: MBUSD
column5: as the sixth best school district in the United States.
